title: Shenandoah National Park: Park Home
body: Nature’s Calling!  Just 75 miles from the bustle of Washington, D.C., Shenandoah National Park is your escape to recreation and re-creation. Cascading waterfalls, spectacular vistas, quiet wooded hollows—take a hike, meander along Skyline Drive, or picnic with the family. 200,000 acres of protected lands are haven to deer, songbirds, the night sky…and you. Plan a Shenandoah escape today!              Hiking Shenandoah   With over 500 miles of fantastic trails, Shenandoah is hiker-central! Here's how to get started!            Dining and Lodging   We offer a wide variety of lodging and dining from picnic lunches packed just for you to fine food and comfy rooms with incredible views.         Discover exciting Centennial events!     Shenandoah has an abundance of exciting events planned in celebration of the NPS Centennial. Click here for the most up to date schedule!               Calling All Volunteers!   Get involved! Shenandoah National Park offers great opportunities to volunteer.        Quilts, Quilts, Quilts!   Check out the multiple quilting exhibits inspired by our National Parks!        Plan a little Ranger time!   Heading to Shenandoah? Check the schedule for Ranger Programs!
